terms.definition: Technical materials that explain how to use, install, configure, or troubleshoot a product, including user guides, manuals, and help content.
A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems.
Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted remotely and accessed via the internet.
The process of documenting and visualizing every step a customer takes when interacting with a company's products or services.
Specialized writing that provides detailed instructions, specifications, and information about technical products, processes, or systems.
Step-by-step instructional documents that help end users understand how to operate or use a product or service effectively.
The practice of teams from different departments working together toward common goals, breaking down organizational silos.
The systematic approach to introducing new customers to a product or service, helping them achieve initial success and value.
Isolated departments or teams within a company that operate independently with limited communication or collaboration.
Any online interaction point where customers engage with a brand, including websites, apps, documentation portals, and support platforms.
A research method that uses multiple data sources or collection methods to validate findings and ensure accuracy.
A research approach that combines both quantitative and qualitative data collection techniques to gain comprehensive insights.
The measurement and analysis of website data to understand user behavior, track performance, and optimize digital experiences.
Systematic processes and procedures for collecting, analyzing, and acting on customer input and suggestions.
The complete customer journey from initial awareness through purchase, usage, and ongoing support across all touchpoints.
